data.title: Thursday, Aug. 8: Only the Strong Survive: ‘Kold x Windy’ Season 2 Streams on ALLBLK
data.meta_description: Season 2 of this drama set on Chicago’s South Side brings conflict and desire, along with new characters and betrayals.
data.text:
ALSO SEE: Complete Coverage Of The 2024 Paris Summer Olympics

All Times Eastern. PBS programming varies regionally.

Thursday, Aug. 8

Kold x Windy

ALLBLK

Season Premiere!

Season 2 of this drama set on Chicago’s South Side brings conflict and desire, along with new characters and betrayals. Rising hip-hop and drill star Malika “Kold” Wise (Sh’Kia Augustin), who is now very pregnant with her deceased fiancé’s child, has fallen into an emotional roller coaster of anxiety and violent fits. Although Kold x Windy have recently signed with Achieve Jamz, Malika seems to have lost her musical footing. Forced to return to committing her “stains,” she’s reverting to the life she so desperately tried to leave behind. Meanwhile, her trusted confidante and group member Renee “Windy” Johnson (Nijah Brenea) is still obsessed with repping Kold x Windy on the mic and in the streets. Despite her bulletproof facade, Renee is dealing with her own set of demons. New to the cast is Reginae Carter as Miss 290, one half of Kold & Windy’s rival rap group, K-Town.

The Umbrella Academy

Netflix

Season Premiere!

The final season of this fantasy series based on Gerard Way’s comics picks up following the major twist that ended Season 3: There is a new timeline dictated by family patriarch Reginald (Colm Feore), and the siblings no longer have their powers. There are also new enemies who want to see them wiped from existence, but how do they face these foes without their powers, and will they ever get them back?

Mr. Throwback

Peacock

New Series!

This new comedy series features a down-on-his-luck memorabilia dealer (Adam Pally) looking for redemption by reuniting with his sixth-grade classmate, NBA basketball legend Steph Curry (played by Steph Curry).

One Fast Move

Prime Video

Original Film!

A young man down on his luck (K.J. Apa) seeks out his estranged father to help him pursue his dream of becoming a professional motorcycle racer. Eric Dane and Edward James Olmos also star.

The Mallorca Files

Prime Video

Season Premiere!

The feel-good crime drama following British detective Miranda Blake and German detective Max Winter (Elen Rhys and Julian Looman), who clash over how to police the Spanish island of Mallorca, returns for a third season.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Eleanor Powell

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Twelve of the musicals starring actress/dancer Eleanor Powell, mostly from the 1930s and ’40s (encompassing nearly all of the features she made), are spotlighted today during her inaugural appearance on TCM’s Summer Under the Stars. Highlights include Broadway Melody of 1936 (1935), Born to Dance (1936), Broadway Melody of 1938 (1937), Rosalie (1937), Honolulu (1939) and Broadway Melody of 1940 (1940).

Don’t Forget the Lyrics!

FOX, 8pm

Season Finale!

It’s “Bye Bye Bye” to the hit music competition series as host Niecy Nash challenges the final contestants of the season for their shot at the $1 million in the two-hour finale.

Alone: “The Marten Chronicles”

History, 8pm

With new weather patterns looming, the days are numbered for those counting on foraging to pull them through. One survivalist is left confused as the Arctic takes back its gift, while another unexpectedly finds a second chance at a missed opportunity.

2024 Paris Olympics

NBC, 8pm Live

Divers go for gold in the men’s 3-meter springboard final. Medals are also awarded in track and field, with finals in the women’s long jump, the men’s 200-meter sprint and the women’s 400-meter hurdles.

Inside the Mind of a Dog

Netflix, available beginning at 8pm

Embark on a delightful journey into the world of dogs in this documentary that reveals scientific and emotional insights about our furry friends.

COBRA: Rebellion

PBS, 9pm

Robert (Robert Carlyle) deals with the aftermath of the sinkhole collapse and the princess’ abduction.

Get the latest from ReMIND Magazine!

Friday, Aug. 9

The Instigators

Apple TV+

Original Film!

Oscar winners Matt Damon and Casey Affleck are back together in a new thriller about two reluctant partners: Rory (Damon), a desperate father, and Cobby (Affleck, who also cowrote the film), an ex-con, who are thrown together to rob a corrupt politician’s ill-gained earnings. But when the heist goes awry (because of course it does), the two find themselves engulfed in a whirlwind of chaos and in way over their heads.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Montgomery Clift

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Today’s 11-film Summer Under the Stars lineup devoted to acclaimed actor Montgomery Clift includes the TCM premiere of Freud: The Secret Passion (1962), director John Huston’s biopic about famed doctor Sigmund Freud, portrayed by Clift. Among today’s other highlights are the drama The Search (1948), Clift’s first film; the Best Picture Oscar-nominated romantic drama The Heiress (1949), led by Best Actress winner Olivia de Havilland; A Place in the Sun (1951), which earned Clift a Best Actor nomination alongside Best Actress nominee Shelley Winters and Elizabeth Taylor; two other films also costarring Taylor, the 1957 Western Raintree County and the 1959 mystery Suddenly, Last Summer; and more.

2024 Paris Olympics

NBC, 8pm Live

Primetime Olympics highlights on NBC include the women’s 3-meter springboard diving final. Action in track and field has finals in the women’s shot put, the women’s 400-meter and the men’s 400-meter hurdles. Also, the first Olympic medals in women’s breaking are awarded.

Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives: “Triple D Nation: African and Asian Eats”

Food Network, 9pm

Guy Fieri puts the focus on African and Asian eats as his first stop finds him in Boulder, Colorado, where they are dishing out next-level flavors like Massaman curry bison and a righteous river prawn pad thai. Then he’s off to Tempe, Arizona, for Pakistani favorites like chicken biryani and beef nihari, and then on to San Antonio to a family-run spot with homemade Moroccan specialties like lamb shanks with apricots and chicken pastilla.

Saturday, Aug. 10

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Meryl Streep

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

It may seem hard to believe, but much-lauded star Meryl Streep has not appeared during TCM’s Summer Under the Stars until today. Her SUTS bow features 11 titles, including three TCM premieres: Dancing at Lughnasa (1998), and two dramas that each earned Streep one of her many Best Actress Oscar nominations, Florence Foster Jenkins (2016) and Ironweed (1987; airs late-night). Today’s highlights also include Kramer vs. Kramer (1979), which won Streep her first Oscar in any category, for Best Supporting Actress; The French Lieutenant’s Woman (1981), for which she received her first Best Actress nod; Sophie’s Choice (1982), for which she won her first Best Actress Oscar; A Cry in the Dark (1988, another Best Actress nod); and more.

2024 Paris Olympics

NBC, beginning at 3:30pm Live

Barring a huge upset in the tournament, expect Team USA to be in the men’s gold medal basketball game today at Bercy Arena in Paris. NBC’s primetime presentation will have highlights from that game, plus the men’s 10-meter platform diving final, the men’s and women’s 4×400-meter finals, and the first Olympic gold-medal final in men’s breaking.

MLB Baseball

FS1 & FOX, beginning at 4pm Live

Saturday MLB action on FOX Sports starts with the Houston Astros at the Boston Red Sox on FS1. Following that game, FOX’s regional primetime broadcast has either the Baltimore Orioles at the Tampa Bay Rays or the Chicago Cubs at the Chicago White Sox.

Mammals: “Heat”

BBC America, 8pm

Despite having fur designed to keep them warm, mammals have found ways to keep cool in the hottest, driest places on Earth. The new episode “Heat” visits places like Australia’s Outback to reveal how mammals find water and beat the high temperatures.

My Dreams of You

Hallmark Channel, 8pm

Original Film!

Grace (Skyler Samuels) has recurring dreams about a handsome stranger (Kapil Talwalkar) due to a mix-up in Dream Central. When they finally meet in person, Grace is shocked to learn he has no idea who she is.

Miss Cleo: Her Rise and Fall

Lifetime, 8pm

Original Film!

“Cleo will amaze you!” The mystical, tarot-card-reading Miss Cleo was a cultural icon. Her infomercials and reign on Psychic Readers Network in the 1990s and early 2000s mesmerized millions. The professional telephone and television psychic, whose real name was Youree Harris, donned a colorful turban in a candlelit room, and dutifully listened to callers detailing the most intimate details of their lives. Her world was turned upside down with complaints that the Psychic Readers Network was fraudulent, and she was forced to defend her reputation to clear her name and escape financial devastation.

Sunday, Aug. 11

SEAL Team

Paramount+

Season Premiere!

After a long hiatus, the beloved series about an elite military unit led by David Boreanaz’s Jason Hayes returns for a seventh and final season to wrap up storylines and say goodbye to the Bravo Team. In the final season, Hayes struggles to balance his career with single fatherhood, and his second-in-command Ray Perry (Neil Brown Jr.) questions whether he will be able to leave the battlefield behind him as his retirement nears.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Cary Grant

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Actor Archibald Alec Leach — who, working professionally as Cary Grant, was the quintessential example of a suave, witty, charming, handsome and debonair silver screen star — is celebrated today during Turner Classic Movies’ Summer Under the Stars with 12 of his films. Have some laughs with titles such as Topper (1937), My Favorite Wife (1940), Arsenic and Old Lace (1944), and Father Goose (1964), while thrills can be had with films like the action classic Gunga Din (1939) and Alfred Hitchcock’s Notorious (1946). Some Grant-led dramas are also among today’s lineup, including Penny Serenade (1941), for which the star received a Best Actor Oscar nomination.

2024 Paris Olympics

NBC, beginning at 7am Live

The final day of the 2024 Paris Olympics includes live coverage of the women’s basketball tournament final this morning on NBC. This afternoon, the closing ceremony will bring an end to the Games with the extinguishing of the Olympic cauldron and the passing of the Olympic flame to the Los Angeles 2028 representatives. An encore presentation of the ceremony airs in primetime tonight on NBC.

NASCAR Cup Series: Cook Out 400

USA Network, 6pm Live

Richmond Raceway in Virginia brings Kyle Larson, Chase Elliott, Tyler Reddick, Denny Hamlin and other top NASCAR Cup Series drivers to battle for 400 laps around the 0.75-mile oval.

Tulsa King: “Token Joe”

CBS, 8pm

The Paramount+ crime drama continues its run on CBS with “Token Joe,” in which Dwight (Sylvester Stallone) returns to New York under unfortunate circumstances.

American Godfathers: The Five Families

History, 8pm

New Series!

Michael Imperioli executive produced and narrates this six-hour docuseries, with two-hour episodes airing over three consecutive nights beginning this evening, that explores the inception, rise and fall of New York City’s five Mafia families, who over a 50-plus-year period had a hand in every facet of organized crime in America, from bootlegging and drug trafficking to extortion and gambling.

Mysteries of the Deep: “Ancient Boat Artifacts and Infamous Giant Squid”

Travel Channel, 8pm

Host Jeremy Wade reveals how a mummy found itself on a mysterious abandoned boat. He then investigates new deep-sea discoveries that might offer definitive proof of the underwater monster known as the Kraken.

Snowpiercer: “North Star”

AMC, 9pm

Will it be an extraction or a revolution? Layton (Daveed Diggs) and Josie (Katie McGuinness) are going to need some momentum as they prepare to jump onto the moving Snowpiercer in an attempt to get Layton’s baby safely back. While Big Alice is away from New Eden, the weather turns and the power grid is threatened.

Industry

HBO, 9pm

Season Premiere!

In the eight-episode third season, Pierpoint looks to the future and takes a big bet on ethical investing with the splashy IPO of green tech energy company Lumi. Myha’la, Marisa Abela and Ken Leung star.

Blue Ridge: The Series: “Heels and Faces”

INSP, 9pm

When a regional pro wrestling tour alliance rents out the high school gymnasium, its mean-spirited promoter is found murdered under the ring. As Justin (Johnathon Schaech) and the team dig into his past, they find that almost everyone he knew had a motive to kill.

Orphan Black: Echoes: “The Paradox of Joyce”

AMC, 10pm

Kira meets with a conflicted ally while Lucy, Jules, Eleanor and Craig continue to search for answers.

Hollywood Black

MGM+, 10pm

New Series!

Director Justin Simien (Dear White People) chronicles the Black experience in cinema history with this four-part docuseries. The premiere episode, “Built on Our Backs,” goes from the contributions of Silent Era pioneers like Oscar Micheaux to the commanding performances of Dorothy Dandridge and Sidney Poitier in the 1950s and ’60s.

In the Eye of the Storm: “Snowmageddon”

Discovery Channel, 10:05pm

When a rare bomb-cyclone rocks Buffalo in December 2022, hundreds of eyewitness film unprecedented blizzard conditions. While unrelenting snowfall traps thousands, one woman braves arctic conditions to save a man freezing to death outside her home.

Gangland Chronicles

History, 10:05pm

New Series!

Following the premiere of History’s new American Godfathers: The Five Families series, this related show kicks off with back-to-back half-hour episodes that look at infamous crime organizations. The first episode is “The Gambino Family: The Gotti Years,” followed by “The Sinaloa Cartel: The El Chapo Years.”

Monday, Aug. 12

Signora Volpe

Acorn TV; also airs on BBC America at 6pm

Season Finale!

In “Death of a Ghost,” the Season 2 finale, an old foe abducts Sylvia (Emilia Fox) and she must draw on her formidable reserves of physical and mental resilience to escape.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Anita Page

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Actress Anita Evelyn Pomares, better known by her professional name of Anita Page, is welcomed to her first Summer Under the Stars celebration today with 15 titles from her heyday during the late silent movie era and into the early days of “talkies.” Highlights include Our Dancing Daughters (1928); Our Modern Maidens (1929); The Broadway Melody (1929), the first sound film to win the Best Picture Oscar; Our Blushing Brides (1930); Sidewalks of New York (1931); and Night Court (1932).

All American: Homecoming: “New Normal”

The CW, 8pm

Simone (Geffri Maya) must choose between the most important things in her life; Nate’s (Rhoyle Ivy King) cousin reaches out.

Name That Tune: “Apple for the Teacher”

FOX, 8pm

In the new episode “Apple for the Teacher,” a middle school teacher from Charlotte, North Carolina, plays the musical guessing game against a flight attendant from Houston. In the second match, a barista from Memphis, Tennessee, takes on another teacher from Charlotte.

Houses of Horror: Secrets of College Greek Life

A&E, 9pm

New Series!

This new docuseries works to expose the dark side of sororities and fraternity life on college campuses. Each episode features firsthand accounts of how the cult-like dynamic of these long-standing institutions can allow dangerous and traumatizing behaviors to thrive with little consequence. Among tonight’s stories is that of University of Minnesota student Abby Honold, who was sexually assaulted during a tailgate party off campus and then shunned from Greek life after she pressed charges against her attacker.

61st Street: “Kamikaze”

The CW, 9pm

In the new episode “Kamikaze,” Franklin’s (Courtney B. Vance) decision to represent Officer Logan (Mark O’Brien) turns the community against him. Meanwhile, Joshua (Bentley Green) grows suspicious of Big Phil (Jerod Haynes).

The 1% Club: “A Lifetime Supply of Hotdogs”

FOX, 9pm

The new episode “A Lifetime Supply of Hotdogs” has a balloon artist, an astrologer and a software engineer playing in the quiz show for the chance to win up to $100,000. Patton Oswalt hosts.

Celebrity IOU

HGTV, 9pm

Season Premiere!

This Is Us star Mandy Moore is sending some love to Ce-Ce, a woman who has been deeply ingrained in her life for the past 15 years. Mandy gets Drew and Jonathan Scott to create the ultimate outdoor oasis for her.

The Great American Recipe

PBS, 9pm

Season Finale!

The top three cooks present their most treasured dishes in the final round of this cooking competition series.

Tuesday, Aug. 13

Matt Rife: Lucid — A Crowd Work Special

Netflix

In Netflix’s first ever crowd work special, popular comedian Matt Rife returns to the stage to deliver more good-humored laughter to an audience in Charlotte, North Carolina.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Jean-Paul Belmondo

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

French actor Jean-Paul Belmondo makes his Summer Under the Stars debut with a 13-film lineup that includes three TCM premieres: the drama Seven Days … Seven Nights (1960), costarring Jeanne Moreau; the comedy/drama A Monkey in Winter (1962), also with Jean Gabin; and the gangster film Borsalino (1970), also featuring Alain Delon. Other highlights include director Jean-Luc Godard’s classic French New Wave crime thriller Breathless (1960); Two Women (1960), a war drama costarring Sophia Loren; the 1981 action thriller The Professional; and more.

The Bold and the Beautiful

CBS, Check your local lineup

It’s a crossover event in the soap world as The Young and the Restless’ Danny (Michael Damian) and Christine, aka Cricket (Lauralee Bell), are invited to the Forrester estate (in The Bold and the Beautiful world) for a party celebrating the success of the relaunch of Brooke Logan’s (Katherine Kelly Lang) “Brooke’s Bedroom” fashion line … or so they think. Might a musical number from Danny be in the works?

100 Day Hotel Challenge

HGTV, 8pm

New Series!

It’s a husband-and-wife competition as HGTV’s winningest duo Brian and Mika Kleinschmidt set out to transform two dated hotels — the 1950s family-owned properties The Beacon Hotel (formerly known as the Salter Path Inn), and the William & Garland Motel, right next door — into charming waterside retreats in just 100 days. Judging their work will be Drew and Jonathan Scott.

America’s Got Talent

NBC, 8pm Live

Season 19 of this variety competition series kicks off its live Tuesday night competition episodes from the Pasadena Civic Auditorium. Live results shows will air Wednesdays starting tomorrow night.

A Boston (R)evolution

PBS, 10pm

This documentary special explores race and gender in politics, with a focus on Boston’s historic 2021 mayoral race.

Wednesday, Aug. 14

Bad Monkey

Apple TV+

New Series!

Vince Vaughn leads the cast of this witty crime comedy series based on a novel by Carl Hiaasen, playing suspended Miami police officer Andrew Yancy, who begins unofficially investigating the case of a human arm discovered by a local fisherman. How that arm came to be severed and floating in the ocean is a mystery that compels Yancy to risk it all, which he must do to untangle the web of lies and various crimes surrounding the arm’s origins. The unofficial case leads him to the Bahamas and down some unexpected avenues among a very eccentric group of characters, including medical examiner (and love interest) Rosa Campesino, played by Natalie Martinez.

Daughters

Netflix

A moving portrait of empathy and forgiveness, this film is the result of an eight-year documentary journey by filmmaker Natalie Rae and social change advocate Angela Patton. It intimately follows Aubrey, Santana, Raziah and Ja’Ana as they prepare for a momentous daddy-daughter dance with their incarcerated fathers. Speaking openly about their aspirations, dreams and the emotional toll of their fathers’ absence, compounded by the constraints of virtual visits, these girls reveal a profound wisdom and resilience beyond their years.

Worst Ex Ever

Netflix

New Series!

From the creators of Worst Roommate Ever comes this series that reveals the disturbing stories of monstrous past relationships, presented via compelling testimonials, bodycam footage and animated reenactments.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Anne Bancroft

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Actress Anna Maria Louisa Italiano, better known as Anne Bancroft, will be celebrated on today’s Summer Under the Stars lineup with 12 of her films. Included are four of her most acclaimed performances — her Best Actress Oscar-winning turn in The Miracle Worker (1962), and her Best Actress-nominated roles in The Pumpkin Eater (1964), The Graduate (1967) and Agnes of God (1985). Also featured are To Be or Not to Be (1983), costarring Bancroft’s husband, Mel Brooks; 84 Charing Cross Road (1987); Torch Song Trilogy (1988); and more.

MasterChef: Generations

FOX, 8pm

The culinary competition series continues with two new episodes tonight. In “Birthday Bakes,” the chefs turn to their baking skills when tasked with making a celebratory birthday cake. Then, in “Memory Lane — Mystery Box,” the chefs work in teams to create a dish using mystery box food items from their generation.

Bargain Mansions

Magnolia Network, 8pm

Season Premiere!

Kansas native Tamara Day returns for another season where she restores neglected large homes, bringing them back to life for new families to love.

The Challenge 40: Battle of the Eras

MTV, 8pm

Season Premiere!

MTV’s reality competition series The Challenge embarks on its monumental 40th season, featuring 40 legendary competitors from the series’ 26-year history representing their “Challenge Era” in an epic battle for the ages. Legends collide as they strive to immortalize their names as The Challenge 40 champions and earn their share of the $1 million prize.

Cult Massacre: One Day in Jonestown

Nat Geo, 8pm

New Series!

This third installment in Nat Geo’s Emmy-winning One Day in America franchise is a harrowing, three-episode (all airing tonight) chronicle of the tragic events of Nov. 18, 1978, when Jonestown — the supposed “utopian” commune in Guyana led by the infamous Jim Jones — spiraled into a mass murder-suicide event, leaving 918 dead. Using accounts from survivors and eyewitnesses, as well as little-seen footage and rare recordings of Jones, the episodes offer an immersive look into the final chilling hours leading up to one of America’s darkest chapters.

America’s Got Talent

NBC, 8pm Live

The series’ Season 19 live results shows will air Wednesdays beginning this evening with the results from last night’s live performances.

The Real CSI: Miami: “Lady in the Lagoon”

CBS, 9pm

In 2000, the body of Misty Morse was found in a South Florida lagoon with her limbs bound together by nautical rope and duct tape covering her eyes and mouth. The new episode “Lady in the Lagoon” shows how investigators pieced together evidence and used pet DNA analysis to solve her murder.

Expedition X

Discovery Channel, 9pm

Season Premiere!

In Season 8 of this paranormal investigation series, Heather Amaro joins Josh Gates, scientist Phil Torres and the rest of the team of adventurers as they seek the truth behind the world’s eeriest supernatural mysteries. Tonight’s premiere finds the group in West Virginia for a two-part investigation at one of the most haunted buildings in America: Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum, a sprawling abandoned psychiatric hospital with a tragic history and countless reports of paranormal activity.

Good Bones

HGTV, 9pm

Season Premiere!

This season, mother-daughter home renovating duo Karen Laine and Mina Starsiak Hawk are heading in new directions. Mina will stay closer to home turning a very dated but “groovy” lake house (just north of Indy) into a peaceful family getaway. Karen, however, risks her retirement nest egg on a bungalow in Wilmington, North Carolina, where she hopes to create a colorful beachy oasis.

Pawn Stars: “Pawns N’ Roses”

History, 9pm

Rick and Chum rack up points testing the merchandise at a pinball paradise. Then, Corey saddles up to an obscure piece of World War II history. Next, Chum sleuths out a sale on a rare set of Sherlock Holmes books, and later, Rick welcomes former Guns N’ Roses guitarist DJ Ashba to the jungle that is the shop, and they riff over some heavy metal.

Rhythm Masters: A Mickey Hart Experience

ESPN & ESPN+, 9pm

Original Film!

Grammy award-winning artist and Kennedy Center honoree Mickey Hart, drummer of the Grateful Dead and Dead & Company, takes the viewer on a sonic journey as he creates an original score inspired by conversations with legendary and iconic voices from the world of sports. His breathtaking score combined with exclusive stories and insight from elite athletes helps show the depths of the universal rhythm found in music, sports and life. “Through the voices and stories of some of the greatest athletes, we uncover the profound connection that rhythm brings to their performance and passion,” Hart says. “This film is a journey into that shared human experience, a testament to the power of rhythm in uniting us all. We dedicate this film to Bill Walton, whose own rhythmic journey in sports and life has been a true inspiration.” The film features stories from legendary athletes like Joe Montana and Marshawn Lynch to Sheryl Swoopes and Jack Nicklaus, sharing their personal insights and experiences on how sports and music share a universal language. The film celebrates the artistry behind these two worlds, showcasing how they mutually inspire and elevate each other. The striking visuals and evocative soundtrack both work to illustrate the pulse and energy that music brings to sports and vice versa.

Expedition Bigfoot

Discovery Channel, 10pm

Season Premiere!

Season 5 again follows a team of researchers on a hunt for the legendary humanlike cryptid. Venturing back to the Lost Coast of Northern California, the epicenter of reported Bigfoot activity, the group embarks on their first ever expedition to unearth evidence of the creature’s breeding ground.

Tyler Perry’s House of Payne

BET, 10:30pm

Season Premiere!

The comedy returns for Season 11, led by Allen Payne and Cassi Davis Patton.

Tyler Perry’s Assisted Living

BET, 11pm

Season Premiere!

Season 5 of the comedy kicks off tonight. Alex Henderson, Courtney Nichole and David Mann star.

Thursday, Aug. 15

Emily in Paris

Netflix

Season Premiere!

American ex-pat Emily Cooper (Lily Collins) is headed for a few new European destinations besides the title city in the new season of this romantic comedy/drama, which will be released in two parts (the first five episodes drop today; the second five are coming Sept. 12). According to creator Darren Star, “Emily finds herself with a busy travel schedule [this season]. From the French Alps to the piazzas of Rome, viewers will vicariously experience amazing new locations through Emily’s eyes.”

Bel-Air

Peacock

Season Premiere!

The reimagining of the hit 1990s sitcom The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air set in modern-day America and starring Jabari Banks as Will Smith returns for a third season. School is out for summer and Will makes an exciting pivot, while also finding a partner in his cousin Carlton (Olly Sholotan). Meanwhile, pressure at work and at home will pose challenges for Aunt Viv (Cassandra Freeman) and Uncle Phil (Adrian Holmes).

Jackpot!

Prime Video

Original Film!

Awkwafina stars in this action comedy as a wannabe actor in 2030 who wins a multibillion-dollar jackpot and has until sundown to collect her prize. However, there is a catch: Anyone who kills the winner and takes the ticket for themselves can lay claim to the fortune too.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Joseph Cotten

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Today, Summer Under the Stars celebrates actor Joseph Cotten with a 13-film lineup, including three of his memorable collaborations with Orson Welles: the iconic drama Citizen Kane (1941), led by Cotten and Welles, who also cowrote and directed; the period drama The Magnificent Ambersons (1942), written and directed by Welles and starring Cotten; and the spy film Journey Into Fear (1943), starring the pair, who teamed up on the screenplay. The lineup also features Alfred Hitchcock’s thriller Shadow of a Doubt (1943), with a terrific and quietly disturbing performance by Cotten; the psychological Western Duel in the Sun (1946); the supernatural drama Portrait of Jennie (1948), also featuring Jennifer Jones; the sci-fi production From the Earth to the Moon (1958); and more.

MLB Baseball: Minnesota at Texas

FS1, 8pm Live

The Minnesota Twins and the Texas Rangers start a four-game series at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas.

COBRA: Rebellion

PBS, 9pm

The government faces intense scrutiny for legislating an anti-protest bill deemed too aggressive.

Friday, Aug. 16

The Union

Netflix

Original Film!

Mike (Mark Wahlberg), a down-to-earth construction worker from Jersey, is quickly thrust into the world of superspies and secret agents when his high school sweetheart, Roxanne (Halle Berry), recruits him on a high-stakes U.S. intelligence mission.

RuPaul’s Drag Race Global All-Stars

Paramount+

New Series!

Twelve fan favorites from across the world will each represent their own country to compete for the title of “Queen of the Mothertucking World,” a spot in the international pavilion at the Drag Race Hall of Fame and a grand prize of $200,000.

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Jane Russell

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Actress Ernestine Jane Geraldine Russell, better known simply as Jane Russell, will be highlighted today with a Summer Under the Stars lineup featuring 13 of her films. The day includes The Outlaw (1943), director Howard Hughes’ Western that was Russell’s film debut and helped turn her into one of the most popular pinup models during World War II; The Paleface (1948), a Western comedy costarring Bob Hope; Macao (1952), the film noir adventure that paired Russell with Robert Mitchum; another Western, Montana Belle (1952), featuring Russell as Belle Starr; Gentlemen Prefer Blondes (1953), the musical comedy also featuring Marilyn Monroe; Underwater! (1955), another adventure film; and more.

Gold Rush: Mine Rescue With Freddy & Juan

Discovery Channel, 8pm

Season Premiere!

Gold recovery experts Freddy Dodge and Juan Ibarra are back for a fourth season of helping struggling mine owners. With increased stress on small-scale miners from inflation, they will only take a cut if they can double a miner’s recovery, but the odds are tougher than ever.

Cesar Millan: Better Human, Better Dog

Nat Geo, 8pm

Season Premiere!

Cesar Millan continues his mission to give pet parents the tools they need to teach good habits and shed bad behavior. Season 5 premieres tonight with back-to-back episodes. In “A First for Cesar,” Millan faces the most challenging rehab case of his career. In “Picking the Perfect Pooch,” Millan helps a fearful pet parent and aids a family in their search for a canine companion.

Bering Sea Gold

Discovery Channel, 9pm

Season Premiere!

Season 18 finds things turned upside down for the gold miners of Nome, Alaska. While gold prices have soared to an all-time high, chaotic El Niño conditions are making the grounds nearly impossible to access, creating a shifting ice field filled with dangerous pressure ridges. This treacherous terrain forces some miners off their claims and creates a funnel effect that pushes the fleet into fewer minable spots and in much closer proximity to each other. The miners must rethink their game plans and choose all-new strategies.

Antiques Roadshow Recut

PBS, 10pm

Season Finale!

The final two episodes of this bite-size Antiques Roadshow series air back-to-back featuring the Idaho Botanical Gardens.

Saturday, Aug. 17

2024 Summer Under the Stars: Jerry Lewis

TCM, beginning at 6am

Catch a Classic!

Somehow, comedy icon Joseph Levitch — better known as Jerry Lewis — has not yet been featured during TCM’s Summer Under the Stars event. That is rectified today when the star can be enjoyed in 12 films during his inaugural SUTS lineup. Included are a few of the movies Lewis made with Dean Martin, such as At War With the Army (1950), Sailor Beware (1952), Scared Stiff (1953) and The Caddy (1953), along with his solo roles in favorites like The Ladies Man (1961) and The Nutty Professor (1963), both of which he also directed, and The Disorderly Orderly (1964), among others.

NTT IndyCar Series: Bommarito Automotive Group 500

USA Network, 6pm Live

Alex Palou, Will Power, Pato O’Ward and Scott Dixon race for 260 laps around the 1.25-mile, egg-shaped oval at World Wide Technology Raceway near St. Louis.

Chef Swap at the Beach

Cooking Channel, 7pm

Season Premiere!

Season 3 of this hit chef competition show returns to Myrtle Beach with host Mason Zeglen and judges Dylan Foster and Johanna Wilson Jones.

MLB Baseball

FOX, 7pm Live

Viewers will see either the L.A. Dodgers at the St. Louis Cardinals or the Cleveland Guardians at the Milwaukee Brewers on FOX’s MLB Saturday regional game.

Mammals: “Forest”

BBC America, 8pm

From down in the undergrowth to high above the treetops, mammals have conquered every level of the forest with perfect camouflage, secret messages and even the power of flight. The new episode “Forest” demonstrates how many woodland mammals face new challenges as they are forced to adapt to a changing world.

A Costa Rican Wedding

Hallmark Channel, 8pm

Original Film!

A clumsy maid of honor (Rhiannon Fish) gets help from her handsome nemesis (Christopher Russell) when things go awry at her best friend’s wedding.
